intro: Bromidium hygrometricum var. anomalum, commonly known as the variable hygrometric bromidium, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in winter. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
